beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: UCI Gravel World Series—international field and prestige
Stunning North Shore scenery—Lake Superior and Minnesota Northwoods
Grand Marais is perfect race town—great lodging, food, tourism
Large field (2,000+ riders) creates energy and competition

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.narration: And here's what they don't mention in the promo video.

gravel cycling Rolling North Shore gravel

beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: Large field = pack racing early, potential bottlenecks
Spring weather unpredictable—rain and mud possible
Lodging pressure—Grand Marais is popular, book early
Travel logistics—Duluth airport 2 hours away, or 4+ hours from Minneapolis
Course is rolling but not extreme—less challenge than mountain gravel

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: The data doesn't care about your feelings. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Grand Marais sits at Lake Superior's shoreline—altitude is a non-factor in Minnesota. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Duluth airport is 2 hours away, Minneapolis is 4+ hours—getting to Grand Marais takes planning. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. The course includes 5 miles of "especially rough, rocky two track with a likely stream crossing" according to official descriptions.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: If you want a big, well-organized UCI race with stunning scenery and a competitive international field. Le Grand du Nord delivers. The North Shore is one of the most beautiful places in the Midwest. Grand Marais is a perfect race destination. The course is rolling but not brutal. This is a showcase event, not a suffer fest. Bring fitness for pack racing, expect UCI-level competition, and make it a weekend trip. The views and post-race tourism are worth it.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.
